bounce back.translation[0].definitions[0: to feel better quickly after being ill, or to become successful again after failing or having been defeated
The company’s had a lot of problems in the past, but it’s always managed to bounce back.
bounce back.translation[0].definitions[1: if an email that you send bounces back or is bounced back, it is returned to you and the other person does not receive it because of a technical problem
bounce back.translation[1].definitions[0: to quickly increase or become successful again after falling or having problems
The shares dropped to 430p, before bouncing back to close at 468p.
